sen.j: しかし、栗隈王の二人の子、三野王（美努王）と武家王が側にいて剣を佩き、退く気配がなかったため、恐れて断念した。
sen.e: However, Minu no Okimi and Takeie no Okimi, the two sons of Kurikuma no Okimi were standing close to their father with their swords ready to fight back, so Saeki gave up his plot for fear of being defeated.

sen.j: なお、『姓氏録』を基に栗隈王の父を難波皇子とする説が広く行われているが、二者の活動年代には隔たりが大きく（約80年）、父子関係を疑問視する向きもある。
sen.e: There is an opinion that Kurikuma no Okimi was a son of Prince Naniwa which is based on the description in "Shinsen Shojiroku" (New Selection and Record of Hereditary Titles and Family Names), but considering the long gap (about 80 years) between their active periods, some are dubious about their relation as a father and a son.

sen.j: 長崎県には、栗隈王を日本の水の中に住んでいる動物を取り纏める人であったとし、彼の子孫の神主が河童に慕われるという昔話がある。
sen.e: In Nagasaki Prefecture, there is a folk tale that Kappas (water imps) adore Shinto priests who are descendants of Kurikuma no Okimi, as Kurikuma no Okimi was thought to be the chief of creatures living in the water in Japan.
